name: RSA Archer
description: This app implements ticket management actions on RSA Archer GRC
latest_tested_versions: On-premise RSA Archer v6.9, API version v5.5

actions.description: Validate the asset configuration for connectivity and field mapping

actions.verbose:
JSON specifying the field names and values for a new Archer record (key/value pairs). For Cross-Reference fields, the value must be the content id of the referenced content.

Create record sample JSON: 

{ "Incident Summary": "test incident summary data", "Incident Owner": "susan" }

Parameter application is case-sensitive.

actions.description: Update the value of a field of a record
actions.verbose: There are multiple ways of locating a ticket to update. You must either give the content ID for the record, which can be obtained from Archer, or by specifying both the name of the Tracking ID field (name_field) and the Tracking ID (name_value). If all three parameters are provided, the content ID will be used as an overriding parameter to fetch the ticket. Parameters application, name_field, name_value, field_id, and value are case-sensitive.

name_field.description: Name of Tracking ID field (e.g. "Incident ID")

field_id.description: ID or name of the field to update in the record

value.description: New value of the record's field

actions.verbose: There are multiple ways of locating a ticket to update. You must either give the content ID for the record, which can be obtained from Archer, or by specifying both the name of the Tracking ID field (name_field) and the Tracking ID (name_value). If all three parameters are provided, the content ID will be used as an overriding parameter to fetch the ticket. Parameters application, name_field, and name_value are case-sensitive.

name_field.description: Name of Tracking ID field (e.g. "Incident ID")

example_values: This is no impact incident to check the ownership and the contact field/.
This group is the default for users with the IM: Solution Admin role.
This group is the default for users with the IM: Solution Admin role.

actions.description: Get a list of tickets in an application
actions.verbose: You must provide both the field name/ID (name_field) and the value to search for (search_value) to search in records. If the combination of field name and search value is incorrect or the user provides neither of them, you may get an unfiltered list. Parameters application, name_field, and search_value are case-sensitive.

max_results.description: Max number of records to return

name_field.description: Name of field to search in (e.g. "Incident ID")

search_value.description: Value to search for in this application

results_filter_json.description: JSON with field names and values of results filter for this application

results_filter_operator.description: Boolean operator of key/value pairs in the results filter JSON for this application

results_filter_equality.description: Equality operator of key/value pairs in the results filter JSON for this application

actions.verbose: Newly created attachment ID will be returned.

actions.description: Get a list of tickets in a report
actions.verbose: The records for a report GUID (guid) are returned.

max_results.description: Max number of records to return

max_pages.description: Max number of report pages to return

results_filter_json.description: JSON with field names and values of results filter for a report

results_filter_operator.description: Boolean operator of key/value pairs in the results filter JSON for a report

results_filter_equality.description: Equality operator of key/value pairs in the results filter JSON for a report

actions.description: Callback action for the on_poll ingest functionality
actions.verbose: This action has a persistent copy of the most recent 'Date Created' value it's seen on any successfully processed record. It uses this to pull all records created since then and creates a Phantom container for each. Records are pulled by referencing that 'poll_report' key of each cef_mapping entry. If any such entry does not have a 'poll_report' key, it is skipped; otherwise, the Archer report named by that key's value will be used as a list of records to pull and process according to that mapping.

container_count.description: Maximum number of container records to query for

artifact_count.description: Maximum number of artifact records to query for

actions.description: Assign users and/or groups to Security Incidents
actions.verbose: Assigns users and/or groups to a Security Incident. Users and groups must be specified via ID, and comma separated for multiples.

name_field.description: Name of Tracking ID field (e.g. "Incident ID")

users.description: Users to assign to incident/tasks. Provide numeric values. If multiple values, then provide comma-separated

field_id.description: Field id for field to change

groups.description: Groups to assign to incident/tasks. Provide numeric values. If multiple values, then provide comma-separated

actions.description: Attach Security alert to Security Incident
actions.verbose: Attach Security alert to Security Incident. Can assign multiple alerts if comma separated.

name_field.description: Name of Tracking ID field (e.g. "Incident ID")

field_id.description: Field ID of field to edit. If not provided, searches for Field ID of Security Alerts field

security_alert_id.description: Security Alert that will be assigned to Incident
